benchmark_details.name: LLM-SI-Corpus
benchmark_details.overview: The LLM-SI-Corpus is a large-scale training dataset for Simultaneous Machine Translation (SiMT) systems created using Large Language Models (LLMs), aimed at improving quality and reducing latency in translation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct a high-quality dataset for training SiMT systems that maintains original word order and preserves the entirety of source content.

data.size: 65,083 training examples, 165 development examples, 511 test examples
data.annotation: Automatically generated by Large Language Models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the generated translations compared to reference translations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better translation quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared to NAIST-SIC-Aligned-ST and offline datasets.
methodology.validation: Tested through various scenarios including speech-to-text and text-to-text settings.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is available only for research purposes.
